bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Theobald Smith, October 18, 1899

div1.p: Reed writes about an experiment with pigs and work involving the bacillus icteroides.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Theobald Smith, October 18, 1899
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Oct. 18, 99
My dear Doctor;
div1.p:
Your kind
letter of the 16th, came this
morning- Dr Merrill, the
Librarian, has promised
to send, by to-day's mail,
the books requested by
you- I was much inter-
ested in the results of
your agglutination test with
b. icteroides- It quite agrees
with our own results-
I appreciate fully the value
of your suggestion about
the use of the viral test
in selecting our pigs-
I only wish that I had
made use of this, as it
would have saved us the
loss of more than one
experiment- I have now
a control & a fed pig
& will see what the applica-
tion of the test will give
use I thank you very much
for this suggestion- The trouble
under which I am con-
tinually laboring is the neces-
sity for completing this work
sooner than I had anticipa-
ted, & hence that we must
leave unsettled several im-
portant questions-

I shall await with much
interest the arrival of
your Reprint concerning
the meat-poison group.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, yours, Walter Reed, Dr Theobald Smith,
Harvard Med. School
